Learn about the most improbable date in baseball history…and then take a big hack at this custom cocktail:


The Cooperstown, as called by Dan Greenbaum, co-owner and bar manager at The Beagle in New York City.


- Fresh mint leaves


- 1/2 oz Dolin blanc vermouth


- 1/2 oz Dolin dry vermouth


- 2 oz Beefeater London dry gin


Based on a recipe from the classic Savoy Cocktail Book (which was first published in 1930, just two years before the big game).


Toss mint leaves into a mixing glass and lightly bruise to release the essential oils, muddling with vermouth. Add gin and cracked ice; stir to combine and chill. Strain into a coupe glass (or a “Nick & Nora glass” as they would have said back in the 30s), letting a little bit of mint get in to suggest the bright green grass of a well-groomed baseball field.

It’s only been repeated a handful of times – and never quite as well – but it still wasn’t enough to make him that game’s MVP. Learn about the most improbable date in baseball history…and then take a big hack at this custom cocktail.

title: Yankee Oddities and The Cooperstown
teaser: While history may not remember him as the most famous Yankee, in a 1932 game Tom Lazzeri accomplished one of the rarest feats in baseball: the natural cycle. It’s only been repeated a handful of times – and never quite as well – but it still wasn’t enough to make him that game’s MVP. Learn about the most improbable date in baseball history…and then take a big hack at this custom cocktail.
